column5: Does anyone have any experience with these rods? Looking to pick one up soon.
Not sure about the vendettas....but I just picked up a Verdict a few weeks ago and love the feel and balance with my Revo STX on it. Can't wait to catch a bucketmouth on it!

I have a 6'6" two piece medium casting rod. It is really light but I find it a bit stiff. I've only used it a few times. These are nice rods for the money. If I had to do it over again I would have gotten a compre or a rapala r-type.
Fantastic rod....reel seat is real nice, never comes loose, lots of power. For the price you cant beat it !
I have a 7' MH, and although I haven't had it out on the water yet, I can echo what's already been said here, in that these things are stiff for their ratings. Hope that helps, happy shopping

I have a 6'6 MH 2 piece baitcaster with a shimano caenan reel. The rod is very conferrable in my hands. I got in in December so haven't been able to use it yet. It's light and looks nice. Feels solidly built. Feel stiff enough to be good with pitching and flipping. I wish i had got the 7 footer though but it wasn't available in the 2 piece. It wasnt expensive either.

7'3 MH 1 piece here, I use it as my frog rod and for pitching jigs and plastics. Great rod, very light with a sensitive tip and good backbone for horsing the fish out. I have it paired with a Shimano Citica and the low profile seat matched with the low profile reel makes it real comfortable to palm in my hand.  Cheers
